title: Overall
stimulusHtml:
This is a main-line question about the last period of the course. It asks students to identify such problems as the need for economic and political reconstruction after World War II, anti-Communism and the Cold War, and the loss of world-wide empires.


8-9 points:

Demonstrates a clear understanding of all aspects of the question (political and economic problems and responses), with thorough, analytical discussion including some specific attention to countries and policies; Recognizes the complexities in the post-war European situation; May make some minor factual errors.

6-7 points:

Responds to the entire question, though perhaps unevenly; May offer more description and/or listing than analysis; Understands the thrust of the question but responds with less complexity than top-category answers; May include some factual errors.

4-5 points:

Offers more description than analysis; Treats topics very unevenly; May make judgmental or shallow observations, but argues essentially accurately; May include significant factual errors if the overall argument is not compromised.

2-3 points:

Responds vaguely, confusedly, or partially; Treats problems and responses minimally, probably with no analysis; May offer a mainly polemical argument; May include serious distortions or inaccuracies.

1 point:

Misunderstands the question and its tasks; Fails to answer the question relevantly or coherently; Presents pervasive gross errors of fact, or little information.

0 points:

Does not meet the criteria for earning 1 point or more.
